TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Layer extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The encoder can be configured to produce video and/or images (thumbnails) at different resolutions, by specifying a layer for each desired resolution. A layer represents the properties for the video or image at a resolution.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Layer class.

MemberSignature.Value: public Layer (string width = null, string height = null, string label = null);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string width, string height, string label) cil managed
Public Sub New (Optional width As String = null, Optional height As String = null, Optional label As String = null)
Layer(std::wstring const & width = null, std::wstring const & height = null, std::wstring const & label = null);

Docs.param: The width of the output video for this layer. The value can be absolute (in pixels) or relative (in percentage). For example 50% means the output video has half as many pixels in width as the input.

The height of the output video for this layer. The value can be absolute (in pixels) or relative (in percentage). For example 50% means the output video has half as many pixels in height as the input.
The alphanumeric label for this layer, which can be used in multiplexing different video and audio layers, or in naming the output file.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Layer class.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Height : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ Height { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ Height { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the height of the output video for this layer. The value can be absolute (in pixels) or relative (in percentage). For example 50% means the output video has half as many pixels in height as the input.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Label : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ Label { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ Label { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alphanumeric label for this layer, which can be used in multiplexing different video and audio layers, or in naming the output file.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Width : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ Width { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
public: property Platform::String ^ Width { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of the output video for this layer. The value can be absolute (in pixels) or relative (in percentage). For example 50% means the output video has half as many pixels in width as the input.
